required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PRIORITI-MTF Study- Testing Patient Response to the IDEO
clinical_study.official_title: Patient Response to an Integrated Orthotic and Rehabilitation Initiative for Traumatic Injuries for the Military Treatment Facilities (PRIORITI-MTF)

brief_summary.textblock:
The goal of the PRIORITI-MTF study is to help determine whether a new type of custom designed brace, called the IDEO ™ along with a physical therapy program, called Return to Run, improves physical function. This brace was developed for wounded warriors who wanted to return to an active lifestyle.
The primary objective of this study is to examine the benefits (and cost-benefits) of an integrated orthotic and rehabilitation program that incorporates the Intrepid Dynamic Exoskeletal Orthosis (IDEO) and the Return to Run (RTR) physical therapy regimen, but designed for scalability in the broader military environment (i.e. beyond San Antonio Military Medical Center where the program was developed)

primary_outcome.measure: Four Square Step Test
primary_outcome.description: The 4 step square test is an objective measure of agility. It is measured in seconds, with a range of > 0 ~ +∞. Lower values represent better outcomes. (This measure is part of the "change in functional performance" composite measure calculated using the mean of participant's score across several objective performance measures of agility, strength and power, speed, and postural stability).

primary_outcome.measure: Baseline Illinois Agility Test
primary_outcome.description: The Illinois Agility test is an objective measure of agility. It is measured in seconds, with a range of > 0 ~ +∞. Lower values represent better outcomes. (The Illinois Agility test is part of the "change in functional performance composite measure" calculated using the mean of participant's score across several objective performance measures of agility, strength and power, speed, and postural stability)

primary_outcome.measure: Sit to Stand Test
primary_outcome.description: The Sit to Stand test is an objective measure of strength and power. It is measured in seconds, with a range of > 0 ~ +∞. Lower values represent better outcomes. (The Sit to Stand test is part of the "change in functional performance" composite measure calculated using the mean of participant's score across several objective performance measures of agility, strength and power, speed, and postural stability)range: > 0 ~ +∞

primary_outcome.measure: Timed Stair Assent
primary_outcome.description: The Timed Stair Assent test is an objective measure of strength and power. It is measured in seconds, with a range of > 0 ~ +∞. Lower values represent better outcomes. (The Timed Stair Assent test is part of the "change in functional performance" composite measure calculated using the mean of participant's score across several objective performance measures of agility, strength and power, speed, and postural stability)

primary_outcome.measure: Shuttle Run
primary_outcome.description: The Shuttle run test is an objective measure of agility. It is measured in seconds, with a range of > 0 ~ +∞. Higher values represent better outcomes. (The Shuttle run is part of the "change in functional performance" composite measure calculated using the mean of participant's score across several objective performance measures of agility, strength and power, speed, and postural stability)

primary_outcome.measure: Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) Overall Dysfunction (Items 1-34)
primary_outcome.description: The Short Musculoskeletal function Assessment (SMFA) is a participant reported assessment of the impact a musculoskeletal condition on individual function and daily activities. This study used Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) modules for Overall dysfunction, mobility, daily activities, hand and arm function, and emotional status. Scores range is 0-100. Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is: ((Actual total raw score - lowest possible raw score)/possible raw score range) *100

primary_outcome.measure: Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) - Mobility
primary_outcome.description: The Short Musculoskeletal function Assessment (SMFA) is a participant reported assessment of the impact a musculoskeletal condition on individual function and daily activities. This study used Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) modules for Overall dysfunction, mobility, daily activities, hand and arm function, and emotional status. Scores range is 0-100. Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is: ((Actual total raw score - lowest possible raw score)/possible raw score range) *100

Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is:

primary_outcome.measure: Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) - Emotional Status
primary_outcome.description: The Short Musculoskeletal function Assessment (SMFA) is a participant reported assessment of the impact a musculoskeletal condition on individual function and daily activities. This study used Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) modules for Overall dysfunction, mobility, daily activities, hand and arm function, and emotional status. Scores range is 0-100. Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is: Scores are standardized. The formula for standardization is: ((Actual total raw score - lowest possible raw score)/possible raw score range) *100

primary_outcome.measure: Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey - Physical Component Summary
primary_outcome.description: The Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey (VR-12) is a participant reported global health measure assessing the participant's overall perspective of their health status. Responses are summarized into 2 scores, a Physical Component Score (PCS) (range 0-100) and a Mental Component Score (MCS) (range 0-100). The 12 items correspond to eight principal physical and mental health domains including general health perceptions; physical functioning; role limitations due to physical and emotional problems; bodily pain; energy-fatigue, social functioning and mental health. The United States population average PCS and MCS are both 50 points. The United States population standard deviation is 10 points. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey (VR-12) - Mental Health Component Summary
primary_outcome.description: The Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey (VR-12) is a participant reported global health measure assessing the participant's overall perspective of their health status. Responses are summarized into 2 scores, a Physical Component Score (PCS) (range 0-100) and a Mental Component Score (MCS) (range 0-100). The 12 items correspond to eight principal physical and mental health domains including general health perceptions; physical functioning; role limitations due to physical and emotional problems; bodily pain; energy-fatigue, social functioning and mental health. The United States population average PCS and MCS are both 50 points. The United States population standard deviation is 10 points. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.

primary_outcome.description: The 4 step square test is an objective measure of agility. It is measured in seconds, with a range of > 0 ~ +∞. Lower values represent better outcomes. primary_outcome.measure: Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) - Overall Dysfunction
primary_outcome.description: The Short Musculoskeletal function Assessment (SMFA) is a participant reported assessment of the impact a musculoskeletal condition on individual function and daily activities. This study used Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) modules for Overall dysfunction, mobility, daily activities, hand and arm function, and emotional status. Scores range is 0-100. Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is: ((Actual total raw score - lowest possible raw score)/possible raw score range) *100.

Responses are summarized into 2 scores, a Physical Component Score (PCS) (range 0-100) and a Mental Component Score (MCS) (range 0-100). The 12 items correspond to eight principal physical and mental health domains including general health perceptions; physical functioning; role limitations due to physical and emotional problems; bodily pain; energy-fatigue, social functioning and mental health. The United States population average PCS and MCS are both 50 points. The United States population standard deviation is 10 points. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.

Responses are summarized into 2 scores, a Physical Component Score (PCS) (range 0-100) and a Mental Component Score (MCS) (range 0-100). The 12 items correspond to eight principal physical and mental health domains including general health perceptions; physical functioning; role limitations due to physical and emotional problems; bodily pain; energy-fatigue, social functioning and mental health. The United States population average PCS and MCS are both 50 points. The United States population standard deviation is 10 points. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) - Daily Activities
primary_outcome.description: The Short Musculoskeletal function Assessment (SMFA) is a participant reported assessment of the impact a musculoskeletal condition on individual function and daily activities. This study used Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) modules for Overall dysfunction, mobility, daily activities, hand and arm function, and emotional status. Scores range is 0-100. Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is: ((Actual total raw score - lowest possible raw score)/possible raw score range) *100

primary_outcome.measure: Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) - Hand and Arm Function
primary_outcome.description: The Short Musculoskeletal function Assessment (SMFA) is a participant reported assessment of the impact a musculoskeletal condition on individual function and daily activities. This study used Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) modules for Overall dysfunction, mobility, daily activities, hand and arm function, and emotional status. Scores range is 0-100. Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is: ((Actual total raw score - lowest possible raw score)/possible raw score range) *100

primary_outcome.measure: Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) - Emotional Status
primary_outcome.description: The Short Musculoskeletal function Assessment (SMFA) is a participant reported assessment of the impact a musculoskeletal condition on individual function and daily activities. This study used Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) modules for Overall dysfunction, mobility, daily activities, hand and arm function, and emotional status. Scores range is 0-100. Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is: ((Actual total raw score - lowest possible raw score)/possible raw score range) *100

primary_outcome.measure: Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey (VR-12) - Physical Component Summary (PCS)
primary_outcome.description: The Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey (VR-12) is a participant reported global health measure assessing the participant's overall perspective of their health status. Responses are summarized into 2 scores, a Physical Component Score (PCS) and a Mental Component Score (MCS). Scored on a 5 point Likert scale, the 12 items correspond to eight principal physical and mental health domains including general health perceptions; physical functioning; role limitations due to physical and emotional problems; bodily pain; energy-fatigue, social functioning and mental health. The United States population averages 50 points on both the PCS and MCS (scores may range from 0-100 on each). The United States population standard deviation is 10 points. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey (VR-12) - Mental Health Component Summary (MCS)
primary_outcome.description: The Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey (VR-12) is a participant reported global health measure assessing the participant's overall perspective of their health status. Responses are summarized into 2 scores, a Physical Component Score (PCS) and a Mental Component Score (MCS). Scored on a 5 point Likert scale, the 12 items correspond to eight principal physical and mental health domains including general health perceptions; physical functioning; role limitations due to physical and emotional problems; bodily pain; energy-fatigue, social functioning and mental health. The United States population averages 50 points on both the PCS and MCS (scores may range from 0-100). The United States population standard deviation is 10 points. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.

intervention.description: All participants will receive the IDEO brace.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Ages 18-60
2. Currently two or more years out from a traumatic unilateral lower extremity injury at or below the knee
3. Healed fractures and able to fully weight bear
4. Evidence of either:
- Weakness of ankle dorsiflexors and /or plantarflexors resulting from leg injury (defined as less than 4 out of 5 on manual muscle test)
- Limited ankle dorsiflexion (< 10 degrees) and /or limited ankle plantarflexion (< 20 degrees) resulting from leg injury
- Mechanical pain with loading to hindfoot/midfoot (>= 50 mm on a 0-100 mm visual analogue scale assessing average daily pain)
- Ankle or Hindfoot fusion or candidate for ankle or hindfoot fusion
- Candidate for amputation secondary to ankle/foot impairment
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Ankle plantarflexion or dorsiflexion weakness as a result of spinal cord injury or central nervous system pathology.
2. Non-ambulatory
3. Surgery on study limb anticipated in next 6 months
4. Medical or psychological conditions that would preclude functional testing (ex. severe traumatic brain injury, stroke, renal failure, heart disease, severe anemia)
5. Neurologic, musculoskeletal or other conditions affecting contralateral extremity preventing the study of a healthy control limb
6. Unable or unwilling to participate in two 4-week PT programs
7. Pregnancy
8. Non-English speaking

facility.name: Walter Reed National Military Medical Center
San Antonio Center for the Intrepid

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan, and Informed Consent Form

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were screened and enrolled at 3 military treatment sites in the US.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Study participants included service members who had functional deficits that interfered with daily activities at least 1 year after a traumatic unilateral lower-extremity injury at or below the knee. This is not a randomized study, all consented participants were provided with an IDEO brace and the Return to Run Physical Therapy program.

group.title: IDEO Brace
group.description: IDEO brace IDEO brace: All participants will receive the IDEO brace and a 4 week integrated "Return to Run" physical therapy program.

baseline.population: 87 participants completed baseline assessments; 6 did not complete any of the RTR PT program and were excluded from analysis.

group.title: IDEO Brace
group.description: IDEO brace IDEO brace: All participants will receive the IDEO brace and a 4 week integrated "Return to Run" physical therapy program.

measure.title: Age
Age
measure.population: As previously noted, only 81 participants completed the RTR PT program.

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
measure.population: Of the 87 participants that completed baseline assessments, 6 did not complete any of the RTR PT and were excluded from analysis.

measure.title: Race/Ethnicity, Customized
measure.population: Of the 87 participants that completed baseline assessments, 6 did not complete any of the RTR PT and were excluded from analysis.

measure.title: Region of Enrollment
measure.population: Of the 87 participants that completed baseline assessments, 6 did not complete any of the RTR PT and were excluded from analysis.

measure.title: Self Efficacy for managing a chronic disease 6 item scale
measure.description: 6 item scale with observed range of 1-10; score for the full scale is mean of the 6 items. Higher score indicates higher self efficacy.
measure.population: 91 participants were enrolled, 4 did not complete baseline assessments and were withdrawn from the study. An additional 6 received the IDEO but did not complete any of the Return to Run Physical Therapy (RTR PT) sessions and were excluded from analysis.

outcome.title: Four Square Step Test
outcome.description: The 4 step square test is an objective measure of agility. It is measured in seconds, with a range of > 0 ~ +∞. Lower values represent better outcomes. (This measure is part of the "change in functional performance" composite measure calculated using the mean of participant's score across several objective performance measures of agility, strength and power, speed, and postural stability).
outcome.population: 91 consented at 3 military treatment facilities and received an IDEO. 87 had complete baseline assessments and were included in analysis.

This study used Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) modules for Overall dysfunction, mobility, daily activities, hand and arm function, and emotional status. Scores range is 0-100. Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is:
outcome.population: 91 consented at 3 military treatment facilities and received an IDEO. 87 had complete baseline assessments and were included in analysis.

group.title: IDEO Brace
group.description: IDEO brace IDEO brace: All participants will receive the IDEO brace and a 4 week integrated "Return to Run" physical therapy program.

measure.title: Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) - Hand and Arm Function
measure.description: The Short Musculoskeletal function Assessment (SMFA) is a participant reported assessment of the impact a musculoskeletal condition on individual function and daily activities. This study used Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) modules for Overall dysfunction, mobility, daily activities, hand and arm function, and emotional status. Scores range is 0-100. Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is:
measure.population: 91 consented at 3 military treatment facilities and received an IDEO. 87 had complete baseline assessments and were included in analysis.

outcome.title: Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) - Emotional Status
outcome.description: The Short Musculoskeletal function Assessment (SMFA) is a participant reported assessment of the impact a musculoskeletal condition on individual function and daily activities. This study used Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) modules for Overall dysfunction, mobility, daily activities, hand and arm function, and emotional status. Scores range is 0-100. Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is: Scores are standardized. The formula for standardization is: ((Actual total raw score - lowest possible raw score)/possible raw score range) *100
outcome.population: 91 consented at 3 military treatment facilities and received an IDEO. 87 had complete baseline assessments and were included in analysis.

group.title: IDEO Brace
group.description: IDEO brace IDEO brace: All participants will receive the IDEO brace and a 4 week integrated "Return to Run" physical therapy program.

measure.title: Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) - Emotional Status
measure.description: The Short Musculoskeletal function Assessment (SMFA) is a participant reported assessment of the impact a musculoskeletal condition on individual function and daily activities. This study used Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) modules for Overall dysfunction, mobility, daily activities, hand and arm function, and emotional status. Scores range is 0-100. Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is: Scores are standardized. The formula for standardization is: ((Actual total raw score - lowest possible raw score)/possible raw score range) *100
measure.population: 91 consented at 3 military treatment facilities and received an IDEO. 87 had complete baseline assessments and were included in analysis.

outcome.title: Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey - Physical Component Summary
outcome.description: The Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey (VR-12) is a participant reported global health measure assessing the participant's overall perspective of their health status. Responses are summarized into 2 scores, a Physical Component Score (PCS) (range 0-100) and a Mental Component Score (MCS) (range 0-100). The 12 items correspond to eight principal physical and mental health domains including general health perceptions; physical functioning; role limitations due to physical and emotional problems; bodily pain; energy-fatigue, social functioning and mental health. The United States population average PCS and MCS are both 50 points. The United States population standard deviation is 10 points. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.
outcome.population: 91 consented at 3 military treatment facilities and received an IDEO. 87 had complete baseline assessments and were included in analysis.

group.title: IDEO Brace
group.description: IDEO brace IDEO brace: All participants will receive the IDEO brace and a 4 week integrated "Return to Run" physical therapy program.

Responses are summarized into 2 scores, a Physical Component Score (PCS) (range 0-100) and a Mental Component Score (MCS) (range 0-100). The 12 items correspond to eight principal physical and mental health domains including general health perceptions; physical functioning; role limitations due to physical and emotional problems; bodily pain; energy-fatigue, social functioning and mental health. The United States population average PCS and MCS are both 50 points. The United States population standard deviation is 10 points. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.

measure.title: Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey (VR-12) - Mental Health Component Summary
measure.description: The Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey (VR-12) is a participant reported global health measure assessing the participant's overall perspective of their health status. Responses are summarized into 2 scores, a Physical Component Score (PCS) (range 0-100) and a Mental Component Score (MCS) (range 0-100). The 12 items correspond to eight principal physical and mental health domains including general health perceptions; physical functioning; role limitations due to physical and emotional problems; bodily pain; energy-fatigue, social functioning and mental health. The United States population average PCS and MCS are both 50 points. The United States population standard deviation is 10 points. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.
measure.population: 91 consented at 3 military treatment facilities and received an IDEO. 87 had complete baseline assessments and were included in analysis.

outcome.title: 4 Step Square Test
outcome.description: The 4 step square test is an objective measure of agility. It is measured in seconds, with a range of > 0 ~ +∞. Lower values represent better outcomes. (This measure is part of the change in functional performance composite measure calculated using the mean of participant's score across several objective performance measures of agility, strength and power, speed, and postural stability)
outcome.time_frame: Post intervention (approx 4 weeks post IDEO fit)
outcome.population: 91 consented at 3 military treatment facilities and received an IDEO. 81 completed the intervention and were included in analysis.

group.title: IDEO Brace
group.description: IDEO brace IDEO brace: All participants will receive the IDEO brace and a 4 week integrated "Return to Run" physical therapy program.

outcome.title: Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) - Overall Dysfunction
outcome.description: The Short Musculoskeletal function Assessment (SMFA) is a participant reported assessment of the impact a musculoskeletal condition on individual function and daily activities. This study used Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) modules for Overall dysfunction, mobility, daily activities, hand and arm function, and emotional status. Scores range is 0-100. Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is: ((Actual total raw score - lowest possible raw score)/possible raw score range) *100.
outcome.population: 91 consented at 3 military treatment facilities &received an IDEO (87 had complete baseline assessments). Of the 87, 6 (6.7%) did not participate in RTR PT sessions & were excluded from analysis; of the 81 completing RTR, 10 did not do a performance assessment & 10 missed patient reported outcome surveys leaving 61 in the 6 month analysis.

measure.title: Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) - Hand and Arm Function
measure.description: The Short Musculoskeletal function Assessment (SMFA) is a participant reported assessment of the impact a musculoskeletal condition on individual function and daily activities. This study used Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment (SMFA) modules for Overall dysfunction, mobility, daily activities, hand and arm function, and emotional status. Scores range is 0-100. Lower scores indicate better function. Scores are standardized; the formula for standardization is: ((Actual total raw score - lowest possible raw score)/possible raw score range) *100
measure.population: 91 consented at 3 military treatment facilities and received an IDEO (87 had complete baseline assessments). Of the 87, 6 (6.7%) did not participate in RTR PT sessions & were excluded from analysis; of the 81 completing RTR, 10 missed performance assessment & 7 did not complete patient reported outcome surveys, leaving 64 in the 12 month analysis

outcome.description: The Short Musculoskeletal function Assessment (SMFA) is a participant reported assessment of the impact a musculoskeletal condition on individual function and daily activities. outcome.title: Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey (VR-12) - Physical Component Summary (PCS)
outcome.description: The Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey (VR-12) is a participant reported global health measure assessing the participant's overall perspective of their health status. Responses are summarized into 2 scores, a Physical Component Score (PCS) and a Mental Component Score (MCS). Scored on a 5 point Likert scale, the 12 items correspond to eight principal physical and mental health domains including general health perceptions; physical functioning; role limitations due to physical and emotional problems; bodily pain; energy-fatigue, social functioning and mental health. The United States population averages 50 points on both the PCS and MCS (scores may range from 0-100 on each). The United States population standard deviation is 10 points. Higher scores indicate better outcomes.
outcome.population: 91 consented at 3 military treatment facilities and received an IDEO (87 had complete baseline assessments). Of the 87, 6 (6.7%) did not participate in RTR PT sessions & were excluded from analysis; of the 81 completing RTR, 10 missed performance assessment & 7 did not complete patient reported outcome surveys, leaving 64 in the 12 month analysis

reported_events.time_frame: Reported quarterly through study completion, approximately 12M.

group.title: IDEO Brace
group.description: IDEO brace IDEO brace: All participants will receive the IDEO brace and a 4 week integrated "Return to Run" physical therapy program.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: Major Extremity Trauma and Rehabilitation Consortium
